intro: Orvala lamioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf lamioides, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Orvala lamioides is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to local pollinators.
